front.title: JSCalendar: Converting from and to iCalendar

abstract.t: This document defines a new set of properties for JSCalendar data and an informational guide for converting from and to iCalendar.

section.title: Motivation
section.t: The JSCalendar data format is used to represent calendar data, and is meant as an alternative to the widely deployed iCalendar data format.

While new calendaring services and applications might use JSCalendar as their primary data format to exchange calendaring data, they will have to interoperate with services and clients that just support iCalendar. Similarly, existing calendaring data is stored in iCalendar format in databases and other calendar stores, and providers and users might want to represent this data also in JSCalendar. Lastly, some implementations might want to preserve custom iCalendar properties, that have no equivalent in JSCalendar when converting between these formats.
To facilitate these use cases, this document specifies new properties in JSCalendar objects and tpes. It also defines an informational guideline how to convert JSCalendar data from and to iCalendar.

section.title: Scope and assumptions
section.t: This document defines how to embed iCalendar data in JSCalendar and specifies the allowed value format and contents. However, this document deliberately does not define a canonical translation between these two formats, as this might overly restrict implementations how to handle conversion.

Consequently, implementations MUST NOT make any assumptions if and how this iCalendar data is processed. Specifically, they MUST NOT expect either iCalendar or JSCalendar data to have precendence in conflict, or how implementations might convert between JSCalendar and iCalendar.

section.title: New JSCalendar properties
section.t: This section defines a new property for use in JSCalendar objects.

section.title: icalendarProperties
section.t: Type: String (optional)

Defines additional properties of an instance of a JSCalendar object with iCalendar semantics. The value MUST contain valid jCal formatted data. Depending on the JSCalendar object or type, only a subset of iCalendar properties might be permitted (see ).

section.title: Modifications to JCalendar objects and types
section.t: This section defines all allowed occurrences of the iCalendarProperties property in JSCalendar types, or their related PatchObject in a recurrenceOverride. All other standard JSCalendar types MUST NOT contain iCalendar properties.
In the following table, the first column names the JSCalendar type. The second column of the table defines the allowed iCalendar properties in the iCalendarProperties property of this type.

Note that the iCalendar properties are not required to form a valid iCalendar component. For example, the iCalendar properties of a JSEvent may only contain a few iCalendar extension properties, and not any of the properties that are required for a valid VEVENT. However, an iCalendar property that isn't allowed for VEVENT also MUST NOT occur in the iCalendar properties of a JSEvent.

section.title: Converting from and to iCalendar
section.t: This section contains recommendations how to map JSCalendar from and to iCalendar.

section.title: JSEvent
section.t: The iCalendar counterpart to JSEvent is the VEVENT component type . A VEVENT component that is a direct child of a VCALENDAR component is equivalent to a standalone JSEvent. A VEVENT component within a VEVENT maps to the entries of the JSEvent recurrenceOverrides property.

texttable.title: Translation between JSEvent and iCalendar
texttable.c: True, if the type of the DTSTART property in iCalendar is DATE.
Corresponds to the DTSTART property in iCalendar. Note that time zone information is stored separately in JSEvent.

Corresponds to the TZID part of the DTSTART property in iCalendar. If the event has a different end time zone to start time zone, this should be added as a JSCalendar location with just a timeZone property and rel="end".
Corresponds to the DURATION or DSTART+DTEND properties in iCalendar.

section.title: JSTask
section.t: The iCalendar counterpart to JSTask is the VTODO component type . A VTODO component that is a direct child of a VCALENDAR component is equivalent to a standalone JSTask. A VTODO component within a master VTODO maps to the entries of the JSTask recurrenceOverrides property.

texttable.title: Translation between JSTask and iCalendar
texttable.c: True, if the type of the DTSTART property in iCalendar is DATE.

Corresponds to the DUE and DTSTART+DURATION properties in iCalendar. When mapping iCalendar VTODOs with DTSTART+DURATION, the due date is the result of adding DURATION to DTSTART in the DTSTART time zone.
Corresponds to the DTSTART property in iCalendar.

Corresponds to the TZID part of the DTSTART/DUE properties in iCalendar. If the task has a different end time zone to start or due time zone, this should be added as a JSCalendar location with just a timeZone property and rel="end".
Corresponds to the ESTIMATED-DURATION iCalendar property in the RFC draft .
Maps to the COMPLETED iCalendar property. The JSTask status property MUST have value completed.
Corresponds to the PARTSTAT and COMPLETED properties in iCalendar, including the definitions in the RFC draft .
Corresponds to the STATUS property in iCalendar, including the definitions in the RFC draft .

section.title: JSGroup
section.t: A JSGroup converts to a iCalendar VCALENDAR containing VEVENT or VTODO components.

texttable.title: Translation between JSGroup and iCalendar
texttable.c: The VEVENT and VTODO components within a top-level VCALENDAR component.
Corresponds to the SOURCE property in iCalendar.

texttable.title: Translation between JSCalendar and iCalendar
texttable.c: An Alert corresponds to the VALARM component in iCalendar, where the action is determined by the iCalendar ACTION property value (e.g., both DISPLAY and AUDIO actions map to a JSCalendar display action, and similarly for EMAIL). The OffsetTrigger relativeTo and offset properties corresponds to the iCalendar TRIGGER property.
Corresponds to the CONCEPT property in iCalendar, see in the RFC draft .
Corresponds to the COLOR property in iCalendar, as specified in .
Corresponds to the CREATED property in iCalendar.
Corresponds to the DESCRIPTION property and its ALTREP parameters in iCalendar.
Corresponds to the TRANSP property in iCalendar.
Corresponds to the CATEGORIES property in iCalendar, as specified in .

Use the ATTACH (), URL or IMAGE () property values of URI value type as the Link href. The Link type property corresponds to the FMTTYPE parameter, the size property to the SIZE parameter. Mapping all other properties is implementation-specific.

Corresponds to the LANGUAGE parameter in iCalendar, which is added to individual properties. When converting from iCalendar, one language must be picked as the main locale for the object, and all properties in other languages moved to the localizations JSEvent property.
Corresponds to the METHOD property of the embedding VCALENDAR in iCalendar.
Corresponds to the PRIORITY property in iCalendar.
Corresponds to the CLASS property in iCalendar.
Corresponds to the PRODID property in iCalendar.
Corresponds to the RDATE and EXDATE properties in iCalendar, plus VEVENT (for JSEvent) or VTODO (for JSTask) instances with a recurrence-id.

Corresponds to the RRULE property in iCalendar. For all-day calendar objects, convert the until property value to an iCalendar DATE (effectively removing the time component). To convert a DATE-typed UNTIL from iCalendar, set the time components of the LocalDate value to 23:59:59. If the iCalendar UNTIL value is a UTC date time, convert to the local time in the calendar object time zone.
Corresponds to the RELATED-TO property in iCalendar.
An iCalendar ORGANIZER with a mailto: URI mapped to the imip method, or any other URI mapped to the other method. Mapping multiple methods is implementation-specific.
Corresponds to the SEQUENCE property in iCalendar.
Corresponds to the STATUS property in iCalendar (converted to lower-case).
Corresponds to the SUMMARY property in iCalendar.
Corresponds to the UID property in iCalendar.
Corresponds to the DTSTAMP and LAST-MODIFIED properties in iCalendar. (These are only different in the iTIP case, and the difference is not actually useful.)

section.title: Locations and participants
section.t:
Both JSCalendar participants and locations have counterparts in iCalendar but provide richer representation.
The following table outlines translation of JSCalendar participants. Where iCalendar has distinct properties for ORGANIZER and ATTENDEE, these are merged in JSCalendar into the Participant object type.

texttable.title: Translation of Participant between JSCalendar and iCalendar
texttable.c: The value of the EMAIL parameter of the ORGANIZER or ATTENDEE property, if defined. Otherwise the property value, if it is a mailto: URI.
An iCalendar ATTENDEE with a mailto: URI mapped to the imip method, or any other URI mapped to the other method. Mapping multiple methods is implementation-specific.

Implementation-specific. When mapping from iCalendar to JSCalendar this may be the JSCalendar identifier of a CONFERENCE property that has the MODERATOR feature defined in its FEATURE parameter values. If multiple such CONFERENCE properties are defined in iCalendar, then the one with the most interactive features is chosen.
Maps to the standard iCalendar ROLE parameter values REQ-PARTICIPANT, OPT-PARTICIPANT and NON-PARTICIPANT.

The chair role maps to the standard iCalendar ROLE parameter value chair, with an implicit participant of value required. The mapping of non-required chairs and other roles is implementation-specific, but using x-name parameter values is recommended.
the SEQUENCE property of the participant's latest iMIP message
the DTSTAMP property of the participant's latest iMIP message

section.t: The iCalendar counterpart for JSCalendar Location objects is the iCalendar LOCATION property, or implementation-specific.

texttable.title: Translation of Location between JSCalendar and iCalendar
texttable.c: Corresponds to the LOCATION property value.
Implementation-specific. Consider using a GEO iCalendar property, along with one LOCATION.
Corresponds to the LOCATION ALTREP parameter.

section.t: The iCalendar counterpart for JSCalendar VirtualLocation objects is the iCalendar CONFERENCE property, or implementation-specific.

texttable.title: Translation of VirtualLocation between JSCalendar and iCalendar
texttable.c: Corresponds to the CONFERENCE LABEL parameter.
Corresponds to the CONFERENCE property value.

section.title: iCalendarProperties
section.t: When converting from JSCalendar to iCalendar, apply first the iCalendar properties in a stub iCalendar component, then overwrite all properties that have a known conversion from JSCalendar to iCalendar. When converting from iCalendar, only include properties that were not converted to any JSCalendar property or object.

section.title: Security Considerations
section.t: The same security considerations as for apply.

section.title: IANA Considerations
section.t: None.

section.title: Acknowledgments
section.t: The authors would like to thank the members of CalConnect for their valuable contributions. This specification originated from the work of the API technical committee of CalConnect, the Calendaring and Scheduling Consortium.
